captions.text: Krzysztof Gonciarz Presents
Nordenskjolda Glacier                                                           Polar Girl Ship
I'm currently in Pyramiden.
It is an abandoned Russian, or rather Soviet, mining village.
North from the Longyear, the main city of Svalbard.
Currently this place is...
...pretty much deserted.
The population is just dozen of people.
But...
we can see...
...residues
of the entire town
which is...
really unusual.
And which holds a lot of secrets.
This place is also threatened by the polar bear's attack. Even today, people saw in the town's proximity...
...a polar bear. So in order for tourists to get around the town, they are obligated to have a guide equipped with a gun.
Without one we cannot freely move around, we cannot leave the canteen perimeter, which is...
...town's social hub.
This mining settlement was created
in the 40's, after 2nd World War.
And for decades, it was a Soviet Union's showcase.
In its heyday, the town's population was about 1200 people and it was a pretty prosperous place.
After the collapse of the Soviet Union, the company that owns...
this mine. Up till this day...
it didn't go bankrupt, but had to stop the operation in this region,
because the government funding stopped.
So the investment was withdrew.
Everybody had to evacuate.
And what is left...
Is this.
Everything here is pretty much in the same state it was left of.
We can find some mineral samples,
weights, old typewritter...
with a Russian keyboard,
stacks of books, files,
plans, graphs.
Today, this place is a ruin of something
that supposed to be a true showcase for the West of the Soviet Union.
No, we are passing sorrowful playground
which is so common in every post-apocalyptic place in the world.
The building in front of us is called a madhouse.
It is called this way, because during this place's glory days the building was inhabited by the families that came here with the kids.
The kids couldn't really play outside,
so they were making a lot of noise while playing inside.
That's where the name came from.
Now, this place is taken over by the seagulls
which are hundreds in here. This is their main place in this town, and I bet they make even more noise than the kids years ago.
In front of us, the main street in Pyramiden.
Named, maybe a little ironic or facetiously... Champs-Élysées
At its end we can spot...
the gym.
We have a swimming pool to the right.
They built in here some sort of...
infrastructure, for people to have some sort of entertainment after the hard day at work in the mine.
To the left, we can see the school and the kindergarten.
This was all located in one building.
They only had three age leves, because the workers came here only for 2 year contracts, so there was no need...
for the kids to stay here longer.
The only thing that still holds the proof of the town's glory days is the grass,
which was seeded here. This type of grass cannot be found anywhere else on the Spitsbergen.
For this purpose the soil was brought here from Ukraine.
It still looks great!
I'm standing now on the wooden structrues which connect entire town.
Under them, all of the pipes including sewage are located.
This was done this way because the ground is frozen and it almost impossible and very expensive to dig out the hole.
That is why in the Spitsbergen everything is located above the ground.
It dried out.
We are in the abandoned slaughterhouse in the Russian Town. If this place is not scary then nowhere is scary.
In this section of the building, the local KGB bureau was located.
Even the miners working here were not aware of the existence of this bureau.
Again, we see the residues.
Everything is in pretty good shape.
Old...
...magazine from 1989. Here, we see some cool doors...
...with a cool thickness.
Russian champagne...
I assume this is not from the old times. It just somebody was partying here a month ago.
There's a lot of authentic, weird things in here.
For example, in this drawer we can find...
...burned documents.
The name Pyramiden
came from the mountain of a specific shape, which looks a little bit like Pyramid.
But the main reason this town even exist is the coal mine, which we can see over there.
It is high above the ground, which explains all of those fittings.It is also a rare thing to see a mine that requires getting above the ground rather than below the ground.
Today, on the top of this shaft, the internet cafe is located. This is the only place in town where you can get reception on your cell phone.
There's no reception in the entire town. So, if we want to get access to the internet or get the cell phone reception we have to climb for 1.5 hours.
That's a pretty good place to get rid off the internet addiction.
We're currently...
About 5 kilometers (3.1miles) outside of Pyramiden
and we spotted in the middle of nowhere
a cottage. In Norwegian it is called hytta. Let's see what's inside.
It is a local cottage...
Although the cottage maybe is not the best name...
Let's go inside...
In general, they are never closed. We can go inside and check it out. Nobody minds it, as long as we don't sleep inside, because for that you need to register somewhere.
So, we see...
Ballantine's bottle. It is empty. Somebody had to be here. We are in the Russian part of the Spitzbergen, so it is more dacha than hytta, but it looks pretty much the same.
We're going outside a couple of feet in tundra and we spot...
a restroom.
Somebody built a restroom for its own comfort, so they didn't have to go after the need outside.
So they dug a hole in the ground.
Comfy.
It's good to use this kind of privy with the company somebody with a gun.
Or have a gun yourself, since you never know when the bear may come.
We're now going to check out one of the most distinctive attractions of the Pyramiden.
It is a house built completely out of glass bottles.
These are just a regular beer bottles.
Which...
somebody used to build a house.
The origins of this house are not really known. It smells like a drunk bet,
But Urban Legend states that after one party, it was decided to use the empty bottles, to build a house.
As you can see, there were put in a specific style.
Somebody spent a lot of time to build this.
The people who live here are tasked to keep this place in its current condition and prevent it from deteriorating.
And their so-called profession is tourism, because there are approximately 2 ships a day with the visitors.
Sometimes unannounced ship can also dock and the locals have to receive it.
Tourists are passing by, it is a popular spot on the Spitsbergen. I mean, if we can even speak about tourism in this part of the world.
The locals are also very nice, they willingly accept new guests.
The entire town looks like the scenography for the horror or western.
Here we have wooden building.
Sounds trivial, but in tundra, there's pretty much no wood. So all of this wood had to be imported or pick out from the sea.
Using wood plans as a building material when there's no wood is like using dollars.
This is the wealth and prosperity of the Soviet Union.
For 2 weeks the polar bear has been spotted in this town and the local scientific bases.
Recently it also surprised locals, as it was spotted from a distance of 40 meters (131 feet).
Fortunately, nobody got hurt, but this also shows the conditions here.
In reality, the bear can be hidden in every corner. That's why you need a gun to walk around.
It is a town in which the polar bears are literally walking on the streets.
This is a swimming pool.
It used to be the northernmost swimming pool.
This is a perfect example of the local thinking of a different records.
There's a piano, which is the northernmost piano in the world.
In this entertainment center, located right behind the Lenin's bust.

Few years after the construction of this swimming pool, the new swimming pool was built which is the most northern swimming pool in the world. Since then the locals are bragging that this pool is the most northern not working swimming pool in the world.
There's always something.
Almost all buildings in Pyramiden are currently abandoned.
Some of them can be checked out under the escort.
Some...
...cannot be visited, unless you try hard.
One of the reason is that the polar bear can always enter it without you knowing.
There were few incidents like this, that the bear appeared somehow inside.
The boxes we see behind each window are freezers.The temperatures here are so low, that all we have to do is just stick something outside to refrigerate.
More and more living...
...rooms with the old wallpapers.
Can't really say what happened here.
This building and the entire Pyramiden had, in Soviet Union, renown of the luxury place which was also...
open to the Western culture. The tourist from the West could easily visit it even during the Cold War.
So in accordance with Soviet logic, a lot of things were built here, only to show the Western world how prosperous Soviet Union is.
We got to the only open hotel in Pyramiden.
This hotel was open recently, but it was already visited by the royal couple,
After the visit, they named Pyramiden, the Svarbald's pearl.
Since this is a Russian town we can drink some vodka and eat a pastry.
It almost tatstes like a Polish one.
Cheers
Subscribe!

comments.text:
Krzysztof, na naprawdę dobry filmik:

Feedback ode mnie:
1. Brakuje krótkiego ujęcia mapki z tym miejscem (ogólna mapa świata i zoom 
in na to miasto), bo nie każdy wie gdzie jest Spitsbergen a jeszcze mniej 
osób może mieć jakiekolwiek pojęcie gdzie jest to miasto.
2. Bardzo fajne ujęcia, mogłyby być trochę dłuższe ujęcia na stedicamie 
albo szynach ale pewnie takiego osprzętu brak, albo brać na taką wyprawę 
się nie opłacało - rozumiem.
3. Może klimat tego miejsca tego wymagał, ale trochę więcej luzu w mowie i 
będzie GIT!
4. 07:05 - 07:12   Kompletnie nie pasujące do ogólnego wydźwięku filmu 
szybkie ujęcia. Przynajmniej nie tak nagle i nie tak w środku :)
5. Świetne filmy, jestem tu dzięki JoeMonster.org


TAK TRZYMAJ!﻿
